markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 3"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Breech Ejectors](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1222)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 183</row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Characters with access to firearms gain access to accessories that can be used with those weapons._

**Price** 10 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** attached to firearm (firing mechanism)

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

These spring-loaded inserts can be fitted into the breech of a [double-barreled](/Traits.aspx?ID=403) firearm over the course of 10 minutes or during the firearm's daily maintenance. After the weapon is fired, the ejectors hasten the reloading process by ejecting the spent detritus from the fired rounds. This allows you to reload both barrels of the double-barreled weapon as a single Interact action the next time you reload the weapon as long as you do so before the end of your next turn. However, the ejectors are consumed in the process, and you must spend the time to insert a new set to gain the benefit again.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Breech Ejectors

Price 10 gp Usage attached to firearm (firing mechanism) --- These spring-loaded inserts can be fitted into the breech of a double-barreled firearm over the course of 10 minutes or during the firearm's daily maintenance. After the weapon is fired, the ejectors hasten the reloading process by ejecting the spent detritus from the fired rounds. This allows you to reload both barrels of the double-barreled weapon as a single Interact action the next time you reload the weapon as long as you do so before the end of your next turn. However, the ejectors are consumed in the process, and you must spend the time to insert a new set to gain the benefit again.
